com.fortify.pub.bugtracker.plugin

Interface BugTrackerPlugin

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    BatchBugTrackerPlugin
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractBatchBugTrackerPlugin, AbstractBugTrackerAndChangesetDiscoveryPlugin, AbstractBugTrackerPlugin

    public interface BugTrackerPlugin
    Interface that Bug Tracker plugins must implement. Also note that the implementations must be annotated with BugTrackerPluginImplementation

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

    • Method Detail

      • getConfiguration

        java.util.List<BugTrackerConfig> getConfiguration()
        Used by the framework to know what configuration items this plugin needs. Configuration items are per-project user input items that are gathered in the plugin configuration screen for the project.

        Typical values for configuration are host and port, and other items needed for filing bugs that do not change across individual defects.

        Returns:
        list of populated configuration item objects. The values fields in the objects need to be set to the default values if available. Each configuration item must have a unique identifier field

      • setConfiguration

        void setConfiguration(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> configuration)
        This method is called by framework to initialize the plugin with configuration values as provided by end user.
        Parameters:
        configuration - map of configuration identifiers to values as provided by user. Empty configuration values will be converted to nulls

      • testConfiguration

        void testConfiguration(UserAuthenticationStore credentials)
        This method implementation should validate the configuration set by connecting to the bug tracking system and asserting that the values result in a functional plugin.

        This method will be called after configuration is set using setConfiguration(Map) method

        Parameters:
        credentials - bug tracker credentials
        Throws:
        BugTrackerException - for all errors that are to be relayed to the user
        BugTrackerAuthenticationException - if there is an error authenticating to the bug tracking system

      • getShortDisplayName

        java.lang.String getShortDisplayName()
        Return a unique display name that will be used by the framework in the user interface during plugin selection for the project.
        Returns:
        a short display name like "JIRA"

      • getLongDisplayName

        java.lang.String getLongDisplayName()
        Return a display label that will be used by the user interface to present the bug tracking system to which s/he should authenticate to. The setConfiguration(Map) method will be called on the plugin instance before this method is invoked.
        Returns:
        a long display name like "JIRA at jira.company.com"

      • requiresAuthentication

        boolean requiresAuthentication()
        Whether or not user credentials are required to perform operations against the bug tracking system. If this returns true, user will be prompted for credentials and they will be passed to the the other methods in the plugin.

        This method should not rely on setConfiguration(Map) being called prior to this invocation

        Returns:
        whether or not this plugin requires credentials to perform operations

      • getBugParameters

        java.util.List<BugParam> getBugParameters(IssueDetail issueDetail,
                                          UserAuthenticationStore credentials)
        Used by the framework to know the list of bug parameters this plugin needs to submit bugs. Parameter values are gathered from the user on a per-bug basis. Example: Summary, Description, Severity etc.

        The setConfiguration(Map) method will be called on the plugin instance before this method is invoked.

        Parameter choice lists and defaults can be made dynamic by having the implementation go to the bug tracking system to determine list of valid choices

        Parameters:
        issueDetail - an object encompassing the details of the issue for which the user is attempting to log a bug. Defaults to various bug parameters like description, summary can be extracted from this object.
        credentials - bug tracker credentials supplied by the user
        Returns:
        list of parameter objects. These value fields in the objects need to be initialized with default values if available. The identifier field must be unique across all of these objects
        Throws:
        BugTrackerException - for all errors that are to be relayed to the user
        BugTrackerAuthenticationException - if there is an error authenticating to the bug tracking system

      • onParameterChange

        java.util.List<BugParam> onParameterChange(IssueDetail issueDetail,
                                           java.lang.String changedParamIdentifier,
                                           java.util.List<BugParam> currentValues,
                                           UserAuthenticationStore credentials)
        Given that the user changed the value of a parameter on the UI, this method fetches the updated choice list for other bug parameters

        The setConfiguration(Map) method will be called on the plugin instance before this method is invoked.

        If BugParamChoice.getHasDependentParams() attribute of a plugin's bug parameter is marked as true, then this method will be called whenever the parameter's value changes in the UI layer.

        Tips and Gotchas:

        • Act on each bug parameter that has dependent parameters
        • Do not forget handling case when param value changes to null (no selection made)
        • Do not forget to set the param value in return list to null when its choices change
        • When adding new parameters, ensure that it is not already present in the return list
        • Return null if there is no change
        • Use one of these strategies (a) Modify currentValues parameter and return it (b) Construct the return value from raw params maintained. Set values and choice lists before returning

        Parameters:
        issueDetail - an object encompassing the details of the issue for which the user is attempting to log a bug
        changedParamIdentifier - the identifier of BugParam whose value changed on the UI
        currentValues - all of the BugParams and their current values
        credentials - bug tracker credentials supplied by the user
        Returns:
        modified list of bug parameters with updated choice lists. UI will be updated according to this list. Return null for no changes (performance optimization).
        Throws:
        BugTrackerAuthenticationException - if there is an error authenticating to the bug tracking system
        BugTrackerException - for all errors that are to be relayed to the user

      • fileBug

        Bug fileBug(BugSubmission bug,
            UserAuthenticationStore credentials)
        File a bug on the bug tracking system.

        The setConfiguration(Map) method will be called on the plugin instance before this method is invoked.

        Tips and Gotchas:

        • The summary and description from the BugSubmission.getIssueDetail() are provided by SSC. They are not the user supplied values. If you added summary and description as bug parameters, use the bug.getParams() to retrieve the user supplied values.
        • Use fields in BugSubmission.getIssueDetail(), namely getLastBuildWithoutIssue(), getDetectedInBuild() and getFileName() to perform changeset discovery if you have access to your repository

        Parameters:
        bug - value object that has details of the content that needs to go into the bug.
        credentials - bug tracker system credentials to use
        Returns:
        a result object encapsulating the bug details.
        Throws:
        BugTrackerException - for all errors that are to be relayed to the user
        BugTrackerAuthenticationException - if there is an error authenticating to the bug tracking system

      • validateCredentials

        void validateCredentials(UserAuthenticationStore credentials)
        Used by the UI layer to pre-validate credentials to the bug tracking system

        The setConfiguration(Map) method will be called on the plugin instance before this method is invoked.

        Parameters:
        credentials - bug tracker system credentials
        Throws:
        BugTrackerAuthenticationException - if there is an error authenticating to the bug tracking system
        BugTrackerException - for all errors that are to be relayed to the user

      • fetchBugDetails

        Bug fetchBugDetails(java.lang.String bugId,
                    UserAuthenticationStore credentials)
        Retrieves the latest bug details from the bug tracking system

        The setConfiguration(Map) method will be called on the plugin instance before this method is invoked.

        Parameters:
        bugId - id of the bug to retrieve. This is the same id that was returned by the plugin while filing the bug
        credentials - bug tracker system credentials to use
        Returns:
        a Bug object with details of the bug
        Throws:
        BugTrackerAuthenticationException - if there is an error authenticating to the bug tracking system
        BugTrackerException - for all errors that are to be relayed to the user

      • getBugDeepLink

        java.lang.String getBugDeepLink(java.lang.String bugId)
        This method constructs the URL to the bug given the bugId. Ensure that cost of this method is cheap since it will be called several times during issue queries. Throwing exceptions in this method will fail the issue query - hence return null instead of throwing exceptions when external links are not supported.

        The setConfiguration(Map) method will be called on the plugin instance before this method is invoked.

        Parameters:
        bugId - id of the bug
        Returns:
        a URL to the bug in the bug tracking system, null if the bug tracking system does not support deep links
